Hi all,

I learning how to create mods but i got serious problem. My model in blender is:

but in KSP it is:

Maybe someone knows hot to fix it?

I don't see the problem, can you elaborate?

(something with the textures?, or the model it's shape)
I modeled that part with two smaller cylinders at top and bottom, but ksp shows it with one in the middle. Here is my biggest problem.
His model is supposed to have a cap on top and bottom with a lip that extends out slightly; in game that lip renders in the center of the main tank cylinder.

If you've moved the end caps in object mode rather than edit mode in Blender that can happen. If you return the caps to 0, 0, 0 in object mode, and then move them to where you want whilst in edit mode. See if that fixes it for you.

Object mode --> select all (double tap A) --> CTRL A (Apply) and apply, location (applying scale and rotation never hurts too).

Re-export and you should be happy with the results
Thanks, it really helped for me. Now it looks perfect (this thing perfect for first my modding steps)

Thanks, it really helped for me. Now it looks perfect (this thing perfect for first my modding steps)

Glad it is working for you. Generally, a mass apply of modifiers and locRotScales is good before export. If I can venture an opinion, your ingame renders would look about 47.2% sexier if you selected everything (object mode), set shading to smooth, then added an edge split modifier (the default 60 degrees will work fine). Alternatively, recalc the normals in Unity.
